response.answer_text: Mark Hetherington’s answer is great; I’d add to it, yes, also you can add it to your web site or book—as long as you observe the terms of the CC BY-SA license. (Probably more straightforward on your website than on your book.) See here for a basic/layperson’s summary, or consult the full Creative Commons Legal Code for the license. (Note, those links are for the 3.0 version of the license; but soon, the 4.0 version will almost certainly be used.) And if you have specific questions, hire a lawyer and/or contact the authors of the article in question.
